items.title: Video ingestion and decoding
items.description: E-001: Video ingestion and decoding. Enable SceneSplit to accept local video files as input and decode them offline without network access. Must surface errors for unsupported formats.

items.title: Semantic embedding and change detection
items.description: E-002: Semantic embedding and change detection. Compute vision embeddings for decoded frames and cluster them by semantic change. Pixel-only noise should not create new segments.

items.title: Deterministic frame selection
items.description: E-003: Deterministic frame selection. Select exactly one representative frame per semantic segment. Output must be ordered by video timeline. Identical inputs and configuration must produce identical outputs.

items.title: CLI interface and configuration
items.description: E-004: CLI interface and configuration. Implement the command-line interface with two primary knobs: --detail (key|summary|all) and --quality (fast|balanced|best). No advanced flags in MVP.

items.title: Metadata output
items.description: E-005: Metadata output. Generate machine-readable metadata per extracted image including timestamp and segment index.

items.title: Packaging and distribution
items.description: E-006: Packaging and distribution. Package SceneSplit for easy installation on Linux and macOS.

items.title: GUI or interactive review
items.description: E-007: GUI or interactive review. Out of scope for MVP - explicitly excluded as an anti-feature.

items.title: As a user, I can provide a local video file as input
items.description:
US-001: As a user, I can provide a local video file as input.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a valid video path, When I run scenesplit, Then the video is decoded without network access
- And errors are surfaced for unsupported formats

items.title: As a user, I get frames grouped by semantic similarity
items.description:
US-002: As a user, I get frames grouped by semantic similarity.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given decoded frames, When embeddings are computed, Then frames are clustered by semantic change
- And pixel-only noise does not create new segments

items.title: As a user, I receive one representative still per semantic segment
items.description:
US-003: As a user, I receive one representative still per semantic segment.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a semantic segment, When selection occurs, Then exactly one frame is output per segment
- And ordering matches video timeline

items.title: As a user, I can control granularity with --detail
items.description:
US-004: As a user, I can control granularity with --detail.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given --detail key|summary|all, When the command runs, Then output size scales predictably with detail level

items.title: As a user, I can control performance with --quality
items.description:
US-005: As a user, I can control performance with --quality.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given --quality fast|balanced|best, When the command runs, Then processing time and fidelity reflect the preset

items.title: As a user, I receive minimal metadata per image
items.description:
US-006: As a user, I receive minimal metadata per image.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given extracted stills, Then timestamp and segment index are included
- And metadata is machine-readable
